intro: Vernonia chamaepeuces, commonly known as the coastal ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Vernonia chamaepeuces is adapted to salt spray and drought conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
